snippet: The plan aims at corporations only and, if widely adopted, would shift some of the global tax burden away from small businesses and individuals.
abstract: Group of 20 for the first time endorse blueprint to curb widely used tax avoidance strategies that allow some multinational corporations to pay only a pittance in income taxes; plan aims at corporations only and, if widely adopted, will shift some of the global tax burden away from small businesses and individuals.

byline.original: By ANDREW E. KRAMER and FLOYD NORRIS
byline.contributor: Andrew E. Kramer reported from Moscow and Floyd Norris from New York.

lead_paragraph: The plan aims at corporations only and, if widely adopted, would shift some of the global tax burden away from small businesses and individuals.

headline.main: G-20 Backs Plan to Curb Tax Avoidance by Large Corporations
headline.print_headline: G-20 Backs Plan to Curb Corporate Tax Strategy
